ReviewList.Text: I have used this book quite often since I started my journey with the Navy.  This guide, coupled with a basic knowledge of electronics and electricity, will prove an invaluable aid to both inexperienced, and  experienced alike.  I strongly recommend this book.

This is the updated navy book on electricity that has chapters on tube and transistor audio not included in the earlier book.Laid out in fairly easy to understand manner with comprehensive symbol guide.Highly recommended book and a great seller, shipped quick and a good price.A+

A very few sections, such as those listing specific pieces of equiptment, are a little out dated and/or a little bit specific to the US Navy. Otherwise, this is a good introductary text on the subject.
Well written and very informative Navy schools have used it for years and a great reference book for the serious student.

Not what you come to expect from years of government training, this course is actually useful and good as an introduction to electronics.  It also makes a very good reference for those little items that you so easily forget!!  A good book for your shelf and workbench.
I bought it as a teaching aid for someone with no previous electronic education.  It does not cover the very basics such as Ohms law, Kirchoff's voltage laws etc.
Of what I have studied of the book so far, it is a very good book to help you with working with electronics
Fantastic, This book has everything you need.
Sent as a gift was warmly received.
Way too dated to learn anything about modern electronics. Yes, the basics are covered. There are much better ways to learn these basics today than when this book was published.
Interesting find, gives just what the title says. If you're looking for something in line with the times, this book isn't for you!
Lots of info about electronics during the 60's and 70's...poor choice if you are interested in IC's or anything even remotely recent.
